text:
Kuleba described the visit of NATO experts to Ukraine
07 Nov 2019, 12:24 by Daria Trokhimovich



Photo by UNIANDeputy Prime Minister for European and Euro-Atlantic integration Dmitry Kuleba reports on the visit of NATO experts to Ukraine.
He wrote about it on his Facebook page.
‚ÄúThe visit of the expert group of the International Secretariat of the International Secretariat for Evaluation of the Implementation of the Annual National Program under the auspices of the NATO-Ukraine Commission for 2019 is ongoing in Ukraine. Experts are in Kiev from November 5 to November 8.
üîπ On the first day of work, working consultations were held with representatives of the security and defense sector agencies, discussing the strategic vision of reforming the security agencies.
‚ÄúYesterday the focus of the discussion was the prospects for Ukraine's engagement with NATO within the strategic priorities of the NRP implementation.
–û–≥–æ–¥–Ω—ñToday, the focus is on political and economic issues as well as information security. Representatives of relevant state bodies are involved in the consultations.
"Tomorrow, November 8, the conversation will continue on reforming the security and defense sector."
The Deputy Prime Minister added that as a result of the discussion, the Ukrainian side expects to receive concrete proposals and recommendations of the Alliance on the implementation of domestic reforms, which will traditionally be taken into account in the RNP 2020 project.

Stoltenberg said Ukraine would be a NATO member.
